It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its striking, spiky inflorescences that resemble miniature dragons, giving it its common name. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to survive in harsh mountainous conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Draconia pamirica is considered a vulnerable species.
